page.title: 07Great Orton School
page.content: Great Orton school was built in 1859 by Sir Walter Brisco and purchased by the school board in 1874. It was named Great Orton County Primary School in 1957. The school has 2 class rooms, a junior cloakroom & a cloak- room/play area for the infants. The sandstone building is well cared for and in spite of its age has many modern facilities. It has its own canteen producing a well-balanced snack meal at a reasonable price. At the bottom of the school field are 2 large paved buildings open at the front which serve as play areas in inclement weather. Originally the earth closets were at the end of the field but this is now a PE store. In 1985 there are 46 children, vertically grouped and taught by 2.5 members of staff. Children are taught in groups or work individually at their own pace
